result.execSummary:
The defendant Amber N. Spatz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
DNA sample and surcharge. 
Jail credit applies if revoked but credit does not apply for Marathon Co. case 2013CF905.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Other Conditions: Counseling deemed appropriate by agent, AODA and any follow up, Absolute Sobriety with random UA's, FTE/School, Letter of apology to victim GC in 14CF307, CC, DNA sample and surcharge.  Has credit for 89 days credit if revoked but not on 13CF905. DNA surcharge remitted in 2013 cases.
